answers.answer: We are happy to announce that a Food Diary is available for you to use.  This tracker will be very beneficial for those users who have dietary restrictions due to medical conditions such as diabetes and high cholesterol, and will also be useful for those who are simply trying to watch what they eat.  In addition to providing a calorie counter, the Food Diary will also allow users to track their intake of carbohydrates, fats, protein, sugar, vitamins, minerals, and supplements.  Used in conjunction with other trackers such as the Weight Tracker, Exercise Tracker, Diabetes Tracker, Cholesterol Tracker, and Water Consumption Tracker, the Food Diary will be the perfect addition to helping users achieve their health goals.  Follow this link to start tracking today:http://www.medhelp.org/land/food-diaryEnjoy!MedHelp
It would seem that Med Help didn't really answer your question :(  I am having the same problem, I need to edit the foods I have in there already, did you find a way to do this?
Hi,That's on the list of features so please wait a little bit for it.Thanks

Thanks for your suggestions. You can now edit foods that you've added to My Foods. To do this, go to your Food Diary. You'll see options for Food Diary | Reports | My Foods. Click on My Foods and you'll be able to delete foods from My Foods and you can also edit the foods you've added. Please note that if you added a food, and it has been used by another member in their Food Diary, you cannot edit the nutritional info for those foods.Thanks,MedHelp

question: First , thank you for this new tracker.  It's great.The only thing is, it seems that we cant edit the items added into the My Foods List.At least, we should be able to delete items from there.Now I have duplicated items because I made errors in the calorie value or because I added the wrong time by mistake.Thank you again for your great site.
title: Food Diary
